nodes.bodyText: These are no longer needed?
They aren't needed anymore. Should I remover them? What about The API ?
You mean the ZAP API? I'd expect the respective implementations to provide endpoints to add/remove the ignored rules.
Should be removed, not actually used.
We should add these as an internal API for now.
It needs to be at least protected because it is used in ExtensionBreak
Better with package though.
We should be consistent with naming, either Js or JavaScript (former?).
I think that JavaScript Is better. I will rename the one with Js
Css
Might worth adding a separator before this one and before the scope button, as they have opposite behaviour.
Yes it makes sense
This should be replaced with the use of the existing option (BreakpointsParam#isInScopeOnly()), otherwise we might end up with conflicting/misleading state, one set to break and the other unset.

ok. Should I also add isBreakOnJavaScript, isBreakOnCSSAndFonts and isBreakOnMultimedia to the  breakpointsParams, or I should only remove the isOnlyBreakOnScope?
I didn't want to persist these options between session, maybe the inScopeOnly param should be removed from the BreakpointsParam instead.

I don't think they need to be persisted, so fine leaving them here.

maybe the inScopeOnly param should be removed from the BreakpointsParam instead.

There are other scope related options (e.g. passive scan just in scope) that are persisted, it would be better to preserve the current behaviour.
private
This should not be needed, per previous comment about the existing option.
!showButtons
These should not be needed.
Revert, not used/needed.
Extract a variable for the row.
Add before buttonMode?
I can change it. Why do you suggest that?
Keep them in order they are shown/used.
Should call discardAllEdits() after setting each value.
Done. Can you explain why?
Memory (discard edits no longer needed) and usability (restore to clean state).
Typo in multimedia (same in the default constant).

Start with lower case.
Technically this is no longer just about ignore files, scope button is included.
isShow...
These should be removed.

showBreak
HTTP requests

nodes.bodyText: Should be removed, not actually used.
Not needed, the state of these buttons does not need to be reset.
Should not be needed.
I wonder if this one would be better in the Display panel, this is closely related to "Show break buttons", we can then disable this if the option is set to "Only in the toolbar".
I don't agree. I think that if the user only wants the break buttons on the toolbar it doesn't imply that he doesn't want to have the filter buttons on the break tab.
When "Only in the toolbar" is selected no button is shown in the Break tab.
Now when the  "Only in the toolbar" mode is on I deselect the option in the breakpoint options params.
Better with an enum.
The enum values can have the corresponding index.
Thx, I believe that now I did what you were asking.
isShow...
